title: Cops: Man threatens to record porn actress' slaying
text:
Share Updated: 12:05 pm 
A 25-year-old Georgia man has been arrested for allegedly threatening to kill adult actress Malena Morgan and stream the act on an online app. 
Brian Blankenship has been charged with transmitting a communication threatening to injure an identified individual, according to an arrest affidavit obtained by People.com. 
Court records suggest Blankenship referenced the August deaths of Virginia-based TV journalist Alison Parker and cameraman Adam Ward before claiming he would use app Periscope to stream footage of himself "opening fire on Malena Morgan." 
Morgan, who lives in California, contacted police in Beverly Hills days later after learning about the threat on her life, and shared terrifying emails she'd received over four days in late August from an account that was later allegedly traced back to Blankenship. 
In one email he told Morgan, one of the stars of the "We Live Together" and "Kiss Me Girl" porn franchises, he'd kill her and then take his own life. 
Blankenship reportedly acknowledged making the videos and sending the emails when he was questioned by FBI agents on Oct. 8. 
He remains in custody and is scheduled to appear in court Friday for a detention hearing. If convicted, he faces five years in prison. Copyright WENN.com
